Job Title: Senior Accounting Manager

Location: North Carolina, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance, Health Care Provider

Description:
About the CompanyReveal is a newly created Dental Partnership Network that is dedicated to investing in an forging partnerships with founders of specialty dental practices, with a strong emphasis on those that excel in performing implant procedures. As a company, we extend vital non-clinical business support to our network of dental practices. This support encompasses essential functions such as accounting, billing, HR, marketing, IT, and more. Notably, our model empowers practices to retain their distinct branding and clinical autonomy.
Backed by private equity sponsors and led by seasoned management, Reveal is poised to establish a national presence as a specialty dental and implant services leader. Join us at the ground floor for a key role in driving this vision.
Job SummaryReveal is seeking a Senior Accounting Manager to join its growing team. This is a full-time position. The successful Senior Accounting Manager will possess a strong knowledge of accounting rules (GAAP), be process-oriented in the application of these rules within the organization and lead the company in managing its system of internal controls. In addition, they will develop innovative and improved reporting tools to drive increased communication on results, opportunities for improvement, and to highlight key successes. They will also focus on automating and executing processes at peak efficiency while generating optimal analytics and insights in real time. 
The Company is seeking a results-oriented, roll-up their sleeves, individual to lead and manage all aspects of the accounting function and will partner with management to ensure operations remain on track to achieve financial and strategic objectives and key results. The Senior Accounting Manager must be able to operate and navigate a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial, private-equity backed environment. 
The successful candidate will be responsible for the following:Provide direct supervision for all accounting functions for the growing organization, including direct oversight of the accounting, reporting, cash reporting, and working capital management functions of the business.Guide financial decision-making through the dissemination of appropriate, accurate, and timely financial information with clear insight and analysis.Oversee and ensure the accurate and timely dissemination of financial management reports, including but not limited to, monthly financial statements, accounts payable/receivable aging, annual audits, and budgets.Oversee and manage the processing of employee payroll and related banking/treasury functions.Oversee the Accounts Payable function, ensuring the accurate and timely processing of company disbursements; preparing analytics on outflows by vendor and trending to control cash.Establish and maintain finance processes and internal controls, which verify and maintain the integrity of company assets and data.Implement adequate internal controls and processes to ensure the accuracy of financial information in compliance with established best practices.Coordinate the provision of information to external auditors for the company's annual audit. Assure corporate income tax compliance by driving accurate and timely completion of all corporate income tax returns.Manage and comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings. Complete all relevant technical accounting tasks regarding acquired companies.Recruit personnel and build an accounting department to scale with company growth.Skillfully develops accounting estimates in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) to ensure timely month end close process.Develops and maintains a monthly close process and procedure, including and appropriate review process that ensures balance sheet accounts are accurate and audit ready.Evaluate existing and new accounting rules and recommend appropriate actions and/or procedures.Assists in other financial and accounting duties as assigned. 
Personal AttributesDemonstrated self-starter, starting, and completing tasks without daily direction.Career-motivated professional who is self-confident, energetic and possesses a strong work ethic.Effective at evaluating and streamlining processes to drive improved efficacy and efficiency.
Special ProficienciesWide range of experience with different GL systems and ability to think ahead as different records are consolidated.Advanced skillset in Excel.Advanced skillset in accrual accounting policies, and cash to accrual conversion.Experience with Sage Intacct preferred.
Education and ExperienceBachelor's degree in accounting or finance; CPA preferred5+ years of accounting experience, preferably within a growing and acquisitive, PE backed healthcare company.Multi-site healthcare experience preferred.Experience integrating acquisitions preferred.

Experience Level (if available): None
